channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Overview of current maintainer fails
item.description: I thought twice about including this, since (a) it's not constructive, (b) contains personal attacks, and (c) has a number of inaccuracies. But Perl Weekly seeks to reflect what's being discussed in the world of Perl, so here it is. Reini lists a number of core modules he claims are no longer maintained. But at the QA Hackathon I know that JSON::PP, Pod::Simple, ExtUtils::MakeMaker, Devel::PPPort, and Test-Simple were all worked on, and possibly more.

item.title: My Workflow for Building Distros
item.description: Ron Savage shares how he releases his CPAN distributions.

item.title: Automating Deployments: Stage 2: Uploading
item.description: Moritz continues his series on automating deployments.

item.title: Alpine Perl Workshop 2016
item.description: This year, Austrian and Swiss Perl Monger groups join forces to host the first Alpine Perl Workshop, taking place at the University of Innsbruck on 2nd and 3rd September 2016 (thatâ€™s a week after YAPC::Europe). They're looking for talks on Perl and other interesting things.

item.title: Training in Cluj â€“ The Poll
item.description: Dave wants to know what training courses people are interested in for YAPC::EU this year.

item.title: Stand up and be counted: Annual MongoDB Developer Survey
item.description: If you use Perl and MongoDB, David need your help: please fill in the MongoDB developer experience survey.

item.title: Reflections on Test2
item.description: One of the big topics at the QAH was Test2, and the way forward. This is a gnarly issue, and no decision was ever going to satisfy everyone. But the Test2 group, led by Chad Granum, worked hard to find the best solution. Joel summarises the story so far.

item.title: Extra-Typical Perl 6
item.description: Zoffix shows some of the ways you can extend core types in Perl 6.

item.title: Need Perl6 modules on Windows then use Zef
item.description: Charlie has a tip for people wanting to do some Perl 6 on Windows.

item.title: Perl 6: The S/// Operator
item.description: Zoffix compares Perl's S/// operator to Perl's s/// relative.

item.title: Refactoring and torture
item.description: It seems there really is no such thing as too much information about call frames!

item.title: Android App with the Perl5 to Java compiler
item.description: An update from Flávio on his Perl 5 to Java compiler.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: April 14th-27th
item.description: Two weekly summaries for the price of one!

item.title: The end of modulelist permissions
item.description: The module list permissions in PAUSE (the 'm' case in 06perms.txt) have now all been removed, simplifying the permissions model for PAUSE.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: The Intern: Perl QA Hackathon 2016
item.description: This year we tried an experiment: Oriol came as The QAH Intern. He joined a number of discussions, but joined Barbie and Doug Bell working on CPAN Testers for most of the time. I hope we get as good an intern next year!

item.title: BOOK: My Perl QA Hackathon 2016
item.description: He didn't wear the expected number of pink shirts at the QA Hackathon, but I did see at least one. He's a friend, which is why I'm allowed to mock him rather than talk about the useful things he did.

item.title: ALH: Perl QAH 2016
item.description: Matt's blog post.

item.title: XSAWYERX: My first QAH (QA Hackathon)
item.description: This was Sawyer's first QAH, and given that he was strapped down and made to take on the Pumpking role for Perl 5, he may not go again!

item.title: RENORMALIST:
item.description: Just one of Steffen's reports on the QAH (see them all here). He worked on benchmarking of Perl 5, amongst other things.

item.title: MetaCPAN at the 2016 Perl QA Hackathon
item.description: There was a whole MetaCPAN section at the QAH this year, which grew as the weekend went on. This is Olaf's summary of what they got done.

item.title: NEWELLC: Perl QA Hackathon report
item.description: Colin's report on the work he did at the QAH, related to PAUSE permissions.

item.title: ISHIGAKI: QA Hackathon 2016 in Rugby
item.description: Ishigaki-san continued his work from last year to port PAUSE over to Plack. He also provided a bridge to some Japanese Perl hackers, including MAKAMAKA.

item.title: ANDK: QA Hackathon in Rugby, Warwickshire, 2016
item.description: As ever, Andreas seemed to be everywhere with everyone at the QAH. This is his report.

item.title: JBERGER: My Perl QA Hackathon 2016
item.description: Joel's report on what he did at the QAH.

item.title: RJBS: I went to the Perl QA Hackathon in Rugby!
item.description: Rik's report on the QAH.

item.title: The QA Hackathon 2016 was a great success!
item.description: If you only read one blog post about the QAH, it should probably be this one, which tries to give a flavour of what happened.

item.title: #249 - The QA Hackathon happened
item.description:
The QA Hackathon was last weekend, and as a result there have been a lot of blog posts about it this week. Lots gets done at the QAH, and everyone is encouraged to blog about it, to make clear the value of it both to the sponsors (without whom the QAH couldn't happen) and to the Perl community.

If you use MongoDB from Perl, please check out David Golden's request.

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
